messages.message: I'm unsure myself. I think this adds a way to bypass crafting's auth layer so that folks can make a POST from command-line tools. It seems to me that tunneling over SSH (the other option) is more secure.

@Victor Zeng can you comment on the security aspect here? Keep in mind that the passwords for these sandboxes are not as secure, and they have dev work/dev mode enabled. Not as secure as a production server. I think we may need the extra protection that Crafting gives us.

TLDR; this change exposes only the `/api` endpoints (ie api server) for backend-dev sandboxes to the open internet. To access these endpoints, users will need

1. An API key from the sandbox. 
2. The secret string for the `X-My-App-Sec` header. 
Assuming the API keys are strong enough security for the public internet, this should be fine.
